name: Oula.la
description:
Oula.la aims to empower trust via payments innovations. Dramatic moves by the world’s highest value consumers, Millennials and GenZ, away from debt and credit cards has created potential for a circa $200B/ year largely debit card- based interest free instalment payments
 
Oula.la has a unique and better Interest Free Buy Now Instalments Payment Model where Oula.la card customers who have opted in to Oula.la Roundups™ are eligible for Oula.la Pay.4™ and provide the cash flow facility to pay the merchants via the Roundups™ pool

Eligible customers save or earn interest from their Roundups™ as well

This creates a sense of shared benefit and responsibility for repayments of the instalments.

jobs.title: CTO /Architect / Payments
jobs.description:
Agile enough to jump into most projects.

Payments and banking orientation
Mobile first technology innovator. Data architect: Big data. Hadoop. Blockchain architect.
Experience across all facets of IT services, including strategy, requirements gathering, solutions architecture, project management, operations, CAPEX & OPEX accountabilities & vendor management. 

AI, Chatbots too

Highly experienced in managing small and large teams and budgets to achieve desired business outcomes, great experience in team start-ups and change management. Comfortable in B2B, B2B2C and B2C applications.

Experienced in delivering payments, insurances, retail, customer services, billing, financial solutions but with a particular passion for delivering digital solutions to drive sales and customer retention.

Specialties:mobile, UX, End to End Solution Design and Delivery, Solutions Architecture, Technical Project Management, Development Management, Applications Management (Lifecycle, Performance and Capacity), Strategy, Digital Technologies

Skills that are relevant:

Ruby-on-Rails in production environments 
Strong Java experience
Exposure to architectural patterns of a large, high-scale mobile /web application
Proficiency using HTML/CSS/Javascript/AJAX
Demonstrated design and UX sensibilities
Rigor in A/B testing, test coverage, and other best practices
